metadata.title: CVE-2019-19049 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** A memory leak in the unittest_data_add() function indrivers/of/unittest.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.10 allows attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggeringof_fdt_unflatten_tree() failures, aka CID-e13de8fe0d6a. NOTE: third partiesdispute the relevance of this because unittest.c can only be reached duringboot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.3.0-1017-raspi2 - 5.3.0-1017.19~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1011-gke - 5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.1

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1013.13~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-raspi2-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1017.19~18.04.1').

linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1039.44+recert2').
